question_text: How is this production classified?
options: Adult Literary Drama,Classic Comedy,Classic Romance,Contemporary,Contemporary Mixed Bill,Family Classic,Popular Culture Property (movie or rock music),Romantic Tragedy,Touring Contemporary Company

question_text: Did this production explicitly address any social or community issues?
If yes, which issues were addressed and how were they expressed in the work?
If no, was this intentional? Briefly explain.
Were Alberta-based artists (excluding Alberta Ballet employees) involved in this production?
If yes, how many Alberta-based artists (excluding Alberta Ballet employees) were involved, and in what key roles?
If no, what was the rationale?
In your view, what were the key artistic contributions or innovations that distinguished this production?
To what extent did this production incorporate new or innovative artistic or technical elements?
Which aspects of the production were most innovative? (e.g., set, lighting, multimedia, choreography, technology.)
Were any sets or costumes intentionally designed for reuse in future productions?
If yes, briefly describe the main reusable elements and how they might be used again.
If not, explain.
Did innovations in this production lead to any measurable efficiency or capability gains (e.g., hours saved, cost savings, crew training)?
If yes, briefly summarise the most important efficiency or capability gains.
If not, why not?
Were any significant external artistic collaborators engaged (e.g., guest choreographers, designers, visual artists, companies)?
If yes, list the most significant collaborators and their contributions.
If not, explain.
Did this production involve any artistic residency (choreographers/stagers, designers, guest dancers, composers)?
If yes, briefly describe the residency (partner, duration, focus).
If no, what was the rationale?
Did the company hold any general dancer auditions for the upcoming season during this reporting month?
If not, explain.
How many dancers auditioned?
From which regions or countries did most auditioning dancers come  and were any international auditions or competitions used as recruitment channels?
How many company contracts (including apprentices/trainees) did we intend to offer this month through recruitment activities?
How many company contracts (including apprentices/trainees) did we actually offer this month through recruitment activities (compared to the target above)?
From which regions or countries did those dancers offered contracts come?
Did we perform at a festival or external special event outside our main season?
If yes, what show did we perform, name the festival or event, its location (city, country), and the number of performances of this production.
If no, what was the rationale?
If yes, briefly note any notable media coverage or donor/stakeholder events linked to this festival or event (type and scale, not a full list).
What was the ticket revenue performance for this production versus budget (variance %)?
What was the seats sold performance for this production versus target (variance %)?
What was the average ticket price realised for this production ($)?
